title: The Tigress of Forli by Elizabeth Lev
description:
The Tigress of Forli. Renaissance ItalyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Most Courageous and Notorious Countess, Caterina Riario Sforza deÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ Medici by Elizabeth Lev

The astonishing life of a long-misunderstood Renaissance virago.
Wife, mother, leader, warrior. Caterina Riario Sforza was one of the most prominent women in Renaissance ItalyÃ¢â‚¬â€and one of the most vilified. In this glittering biography, Elizabeth Lev reexamines her extraordinary life and accomplishments.

Raised in the court of Milan and wed at age ten to the popeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s corrupt nephew, Caterina was ensnared in ItalyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s political intrigues early in life. After turbulent years in RomeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s papal court, she moved to the Romagnol province of ForlÃƒÂ¬. Following her husbandÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s assassination, she ruled ItalyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s crossroads with iron will, martial strength, political savvyÃ¢â‚¬â€and an iconÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s fashion sense. 

In finally losing her lands to the Borgia family, she put up a resistance that inspired all of Europe and set the stage for her progenyÃ¢â‚¬â€including Cosimo de MediciÃ¢â‚¬â€to follow her example to greatness.
A rich evocation the Renaissance,The Tigress of ForlÃƒÂ¬ reveals Caterina Riario Sforza as a brilliant and fearless ruler, and a tragic but unbowed figure.

Genre: Non Fiction | History | Biography
